required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of Lanthanum Carbonate and Sevelamer Hydrochloride in Patients Receiving Haemodialysis for End Stage Renal Disease
clinical_study.official_title: A Multi-Centre, Open Label, Randomized, Parallel Group Pilot Study to Assess the Efficacy and Safety of Lanthanum Carbonate and Sevelamer Hydrochloride in Patients Receiving Haemodialysis for End Stage Renal Disease

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess phosphate reduction and control in patients with End Stage Renal Disease treated with either lanthanum carbonate or sevelamer hydrochloride

primary_outcome.time_frame: The last 4 weeks of the treatment period (Weeks 5, 6, 7, & 8)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: The last 4 weeks of the treatment period (Weeks 5, 6, 7, & 8)
The last 4 weeks of the treatment period (Weeks 5, 6, 7, & 8)
Daily throughout for the 8 week Evaluation for Dose Adjustment Period up to the End of Study/ Withdrawal Visit.
Throughout the study period of approximately 7.5 months.
secondary_outcome.description: Treatment-emergent adverse events (TEAEs) were defined as AEs that had an onset date and time on or after the date and time of the first dose of study medication.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients receiving haemodialysis for ESRD
- Patients must have received haemodialysis for chronic renal failure three times per week for at least the previous 2 months
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant or lactating women
- Patients with clinically significant uncontrolled concurrent illness, a life-threatening malignancy or current multiple myeloma
- Patients who are HIV+
- Patients with any significant bowel obstruction, active inflammatory bowel disease, GI motility disorders, or a history of major GI surgery within the last 6 months
